alert.note: Alert for Lexington; Newberry; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 6:12PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Newberry, northwestern Lexington and northeastern Saluda Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 611 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Batesburg-Leesville, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cedar Grove Fire Station, Lake Murray Shores, South Shore Marina, Circle Fire Station, Delmar, Wyses Ferry and Riverbend Boat Ramp. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
